There is a reasonable chance Student_A never applies to us, and Student_B might apply if not accepted by School_A. But we have only one seat and currently have a firm application from Student_C. Given the round-1 context and that accepting now secures a solid match with a student who strongly prefers us, I will accept rather than gamble on higher-ranked students who may not come.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for checking in and for your continued interest in School_E.

On your question about whether our single seat is currently held: we’re not able to share details about another applicant’s status. At this time, we still do not have an open seat to offer, and any late movement would depend on whether a decline occurs and when that information is finalized. Because of that, we cannot provide a specific window beyond noting that any changes—if they happen—tend to occur on short notice.

Regarding transcript format: an emailed PDF from your school counselor/registrar (official school email) is typically the fastest and preferred option for a last-minute review. If your school issues official transcripts via a secure electronic system, that is also acceptable. If your school’s process is sealed hard copy only, that can work as well, but it may slow timing.

If a seat opens, we will review the available files promptly and contact candidates directly. In the meantime, you do not need to send anything further unless you receive the official transcript or have a new, verifiable update.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest in School_E.

Yes—having your counselor/registrar send your official transcript proactively as soon as it is released would be helpful, so we can move quickly if our single-seat capacity changes at short notice.

Preferred submission method:
- An emailed PDF sent directly from your registrar/counselor using an official school email account.

Please ask them to include in the email:

Dear Student_E,

Thank you for checking in and for keeping your file active.

1) Seat availability: There has been no change since last round—we still do not have an open seat to offer at this time.
